sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Handwritten letter from Schenker to Cotta, dated January 4, 1909
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: Schenker directs Cotta to divulge his name on the title-page of the 2nd edn of Harmonielehre; — He has meanwhile added a long polemic to the Introduction of Kontrapunkt [I].

tei:div.tei:p: Ich war gerade im Begriffe die ersten Blätter abzusenden, als Ihr Kl. VgkatalogReading of "Kl. Vgkatalog" uncertain, since there appears to be a dot over the "g". As there is apparently no letter to which this responds, presumably Cotta has recently sent him the preceding catalogue, or a proof of the new catalogue, annotated with questions about the reprinting of volume I, Harmonielehre. (There is no reference to a new edition in OJ 9/31, [21], December 30, 1908, to which he had in any case partly responded in CA 91, January 4.) mit den Fragen kam. Bitte, ja. Natürlich, u. mehr als das, ich ersuche Sie auch das Titelblatt bei Bd. I auf den übrigen Exemplaren umzudrucken, d.h. dort den Namen anzuführen, wie folgt: N. M. Th. u Phantasien (bleibt!) von Heinrich Schenker (ohne Dr. Titel!)This is how it appears on the series title-page subsequent to the first edition. Up to this point, Schenker had insisted on authorial anonymity, the first edition of Harmonielehre having the attribution "von einem Künstler" ("by an artist"). u. überlasse Ihnen den Zeitpunkt hiefür zu wählen, ob es erst gleichzeitig mit der Ausgabe des Kontrapunktes oder schon jetzt zu geschehen hätte.

Da ich nicht sobald eine II. Aufl. des Bd. I, (trotz oft sehr entusiastischen Briefen aus Deutschland, z.B. von Prof. Rudorff, Mitglied des Senats der Kgl. Hochschule in Berlin u.s.w.Recent letters to Schenker from Ernst Rudorff are OJ 13/37, 4, October 1, 1908, and OJ 13/37, 5, November 21, 1908.) zu erwarten habe, war ich genötigt bei S.7 der Korrektur eine etwa 2½ Druckseiten umfassende Polemik einzuschalten, die im Interesse des Bd. I auszutragen war.Schenker has clearly reverted to Kontrapunkt at this point. The most likely candidate passage for this is the section in small type running from partway down p. 10 to the top of p. 14 (just short of three pages = Eng. transl., bottom of p. 6 to two-thirds down p. 9), which engages in polemic against E. F. Richter (where he cross-refers to Harmonielehre, §§90–92), Hugo Riemann, Siegfried Dehn, and Heinrich Bellermann. It could, just possibly, refer to the whole subsection II, pp. 8–14 (Eng. transl., pp. 6–10). Die nächsten
Blätter aber gehen ruhig vor sich, ohne nennenswerten Zuwachs.

I was on the brink of sending off the opening pages when your small publications catalogue arrived with its questions. Yes, please. Of course, and I would be glad moreover if you would also re-set the title-page of volume I in the remaining copies, giving the name there as follows: "New Musical Theories and Fantasies" (unchanged!) "by Heinrich Schenker" (with no "Dr." in front of it). And I will leave you to select the deadline for this ‒ whether it should wait and be simultaneous with the publication of Counterpoint, or whether it should go ahead right away now.

Since I had not been expecting a second edition of volume I so soon (despite frequent, very enthusiastic letters from Germany, e.g. from Prof. Rudorff, member of the Senate of the Royal Highschool in Berlin, etc.), I had felt compelled to insert a wide-ranging, roughly two-and-a-half-page polemical statement into p.7 of the proofs, which it was very much in the interests of volume I to implement. However, the
subsequent pages run on smoothly, without any additions to speak of.
